div.p: Greetings. I have received and understood well what you wrote and sent, and I realize that caution is needed in the future.

Therefore, do not be anxious. I cannot do more now due to various tasks and a mind completely distracted. I am sending what I received yesterday from France, to reciprocate; for I acknowledge that your efforts in writing are great. We see that we must pray to God, that He may certainly moderate difficult matters according to His mercy.
May all friends and brothers be well. Farewell together with your family. ZÃ¼rich, 17th of April, 1573.
To Mr. Tobias Egli, pastor of the Church of Chur at St. Martin, his lord and brother.
